intro: Silene inaperta subsp. inaperta, commonly known as the narrowleaf catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has slender, branching stems with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Silene inaperta subsp. inaperta is often found in open areas such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
